f965be4b-ccc9-494e-884a-3a360ddf84fe.description: The Frontline Leadership program provides a toolkit of practical communication and employee development tools that reduce conflict, improve employee performance, and enhance team effectiveness. Earners of this microcredential have learned to deliver clear direction, coach employees and provide effective feedback. The ultimate goal of the training is to enable the earners to be leaders and to create work environments that foster employee engagement and improve performance.
f965be4b-ccc9-494e-884a-3a360ddf84fe.name: Frontline Leadership (v.01)

issuer.summary: issued by Eastern Iowa Community Colleges

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the important role leaders play in the success of the organization and the qualities, skills and traits required of highly effective leaders.
Learn strategies to understand personality and communication differences, while providing clear and practical tools for adapting communication to be more effective in the workplace
Analyze levels of engagement within workforces, and brainstorm interventions to help improve engagement and satisfaction within teams.
Apply a model to help develop effective teams through activities requiring effective communication, dialogue, and problem-solving skills
Learn the core skills of listening, providing feedback, and giving praise and recognition.
Utilize tools to help clearly communicate job expectations, as well as ways to provide ongoing feedback and monitoring of performance
Assess current leadership approaches and analyze employee development
Explore behaviors needed for effective coaching and use a structured process for planning for a coaching conversation
Identify clear strategies and techniques for effectively managing conflict on a team
Recognize the impact of change within an organization, and identify what tools are best for planning for and conducting a change conversation with the team

a7ce2c7f-1e7c-49b8-b26a-694d1edb588d.description: The ability to exhibit leadership behavior is an important skill to local employers. To earn this microcredential, the student was observed at a "point in time" performing all of the skills listed below at an Exceptional level by an instructor during a course at Eastern Iowa Community Colleges. Exceptional= Exceeds basic expectations. Consistently demonstrates superior performance and behavior. Serves as a role model for others.
a7ce2c7f-1e7c-49b8-b26a-694d1edb588d.name: Leadership: Beyond Management (v.01)

issuer.summary: issued by Eastern Iowa Community Colleges

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully demonstrated use and understanding of all leadership skills learned within course.
Understood the difference between leadership and management mindset.
Applied the concept of the adaptive change model to a real work example
Identified barriers that could prevent organizational evolution.
Identified the four behaviors necessary for effective dialogue, including their barriers/challenges and their ability to help achieve meaningful dialogue.
Developed a personal improvement plan relevant to individual leadership journey and goals.

2824c36f-a3c9-406d-b8fb-6258caa53bb6.description: The ability to diagnose causes and solutions of conflict is an important skill to local employers. To earn this microcredential, the student was observed at a "point in time" performing all of the skills listed below at an Exceptional level by an instructor during a course at Eastern Iowa Community Colleges. Exceptional= Exceeds basic expectations. Consistently demonstrates superior performance and behavior. Serves as a role model for others.
2824c36f-a3c9-406d-b8fb-6258caa53bb6.name: Conflict Management (v.01)

issuer.summary: issued by Eastern Iowa Community Colleges

badge_template_activities.title: Understood key attributes of listening
Understood barriers to listening
Correctly explained, using examples, the four levels of listening
Defined conflict and the implication of the definition
Demonstrated a clear understanding of the conflict episode
Explained the dynamics of conflict escalation, including distributive and integrative solution paths
Used the Neutral Statement method to determine type of conflict
Demonstrated a clear understanding of the three types of conflict: Factual, Interest Based and Behavioral
Explained conflict de-escalation by using examples of the solution path for each type of conflict
Understood the meaning and intent of dialogue
Demonstrated use of Humble Inquiry questioning techniques to achieve "listening to understand"
Understood and demonstrated using examples of the four behaviors of effective dialogue (listening, respecting, suspending and voicing)

Completed oral presentation using a real conflict example, listening and dialogical skills, to explain conflict management and the techniques to maneuver the conflict episode to appropriate solution paths.

c85cd36b-301e-413e-b86b-8f2cea3d915c.description: Emotional Intelligence (EI) is the ability to be self-aware of how your emotions, and the emotions of others, affect the workplace. Research shows your emotional quotient (EQ) is a more accurate predictor of leadership and management success than your IQ. This workshop will increase your EQ by understanding and using Emotional Intelligence so you can work well with others, put your problem-solving skills to use in challenging situations, and build better working relations.
c85cd36b-301e-413e-b86b-8f2cea3d915c.name: Leadership: Developing Your Emotional Quotient

issuer.summary: issued by Eastern Iowa Community Colleges

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the source and functions of emotions.
Develop a greater application for the role of emotions at work.
Become more cognizant of emotions.
Discover the connections between your emotions and your work.
Know how to act professionally when emotions (yours and others) interfered with your ability to do your job.
Discover how to manage negative emotions.
Learn to direct the power of positive emotions for higher levels of performance.
Explore the difference between sympathy and empathy.
Uncover personal barriers to empathy.
Learn to recognize and respond to the emotional clues from others.
Develop your map of mutual interdependence.
Appreciate the role of deep listening in connecting with others.
Understand the importance of inquiry and dialogue in building trusting relationships.
Learn to apply the most effective responses to others in specific situations.

b0d97bd7-44f4-4c3c-8a01-7b236dc65656.description: The ability to exhibit leadership behavior is an important skill for career development. To earn this microcredential, the student was observed at a "point in time" performing all of the skills listed below at an Exceptional level by an instructor during a course at Eastern Iowa Community Colleges. Exceptional= Exceeds basic expectations. Consistently demonstrates superior performance and behavior. Serves as a role model for others.
b0d97bd7-44f4-4c3c-8a01-7b236dc65656.name: USACE Leadership Development Program II Knowledge (v.01)

issuer.summary: issued by Eastern Iowa Community Colleges

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully demonstrated use and understanding of all leadership skills learned within course.
Identified emotional triggers in one's self and others, and how they may affect work.
Cultivated a toolbox of leadership skills needed for organizational strategic planning and thinking
Facilitated a process approach scenario where the people affected by the change are integral to creating the change solutions.
Understood how the conflict episode unfolds and how to take action to avoid escalation.
Applied a the correct solution to a given conflict to de-escalate the situation.
Differentiated between the four levels of listening as they apply to conflict.
Demonstrated the four behaviors of effective dialogue and how these behaviors can improve decision-making capability.
